analysis.title: The Hangover
analysis.author: Jon Lucas & Scott Moore
analysis.logline: Four friends lose the groom during a wild Las Vegas bachelor party and must retrace their steps to find him before his wedding.

concept.justification: High-concept comedy premise with built-in mystery and comedic potential. Instantly marketable one-sentence pitch.

structure.justification: Tight three-act structure with clear escalating stakes. Mystery of missing groom drives narrative momentum.

protagonist.justification: Ensemble approach, with Alan emerging as the most distinctive character. Clear character arcs and group dynamic.

supporting_cast.justification: Richly drawn characters with distinct personalities. Each member of the group feels fully realized.

dialogue.justification: Sharp, quotable lines. Each character has a unique voice. Excellent comedic timing and subtext.

genre_execution.justification: Masterful comedy execution. Balances outrageous humor with genuine character moments.

originality.justification: Fresh take on bachelor party comedy. Innovative narrative structure with mystery element.

major_weaknesses: Extremely raunchy humor might limit audience

target_audience.note: Clear 18-35 male demographic with broad appeal

cast_attachability.note: Ensemble comedy with multiple star-making roles

marketing_hook.note: Trailer-friendly concept with memorable comedic setpieces

comparable_success.note: Similar comedies like Superbad and Wedding Crashers were massive hits

analysis.verdict_statement: FILM NOW: THE HANGOVER represents exceptional material that demands immediate greenlight consideration. The Lightning: Four friends lose a groom in Vegas, sparking a hilarious mystery. The Craft: Weighted score of 8.65 with no dimension below 8. The Commercial Case: CVS of 18/18. Bradley Cooper and Zach Galifianakis present star potential. Urgency: This screenplay will not remain available.
